mdRecord.dcterms:title: African-American Men, Southwest United States, ca. 1893
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This photograph shows Three African-American men posed for the camera (one is seated, the other two are standing) in front of a wooden building. Though the location is unknown, it is beleived to be in the American southwest (in either Texas, Arizona, or New Mexico) ca 1893. Two handmade signs behind them advertize "Spiced Pigs's Feet and Tripe", and "Finest Sugar Cured Meats". Image slightly faded to yellowish brown in center and faint yellow on left and right sides. A brownish spot is on the photo in the center
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: George Mason University Libraries Special Collections Research Center
